</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="method">Method<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#method" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p><strong>Standardisation of mercuric nitrate</strong> To 2 ml of standard NaCl (10 mmol/L) add 2 drops of indicator and titrate with mercuric nitrate. The end point is reached when there is a colour change to pale violet. Repeat twice and take the average of the three readings.</p>
<p><strong>Titration of plasma</strong> To 1.8 ml of distilled water, add 0.2 ml of plasma. Add 2 drops of the indicator and titrate with mercuric nitrate. During titration, solution will change from salmon pink to deep purple on the addition of mercuric nitrate. Further titration will yield a sudden a change from pale yellow to pale violet. This is the end point. Note the reading.</p>
<p>&gt; <strong>Note</strong> The end point is clearer if protein-free filtrate of plasma is used for the titration.</p>
<p><strong>Titration of Standard</strong> Titrate 2.0 ml of the standard chloride in the same way as plasma.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="calculation">Calculation<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#calculation" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mtext>Titration&nbsp;of&nbsp;test</mtext><mtext>Titration&nbsp;of&nbsp;standard</mtext></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn><mo>=</mo><mtext>mmol/litre&nbsp;of&nbsp;serum&nbsp;chloride</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{\text{Titration of test}}{\text{Titration of standard}} \times 100 = \text{mmol/litre of serum chloride}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.0574em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3714em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Titration&nbsp;of&nbsp;standard</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Titration&nbsp;of&nbsp;test</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">100</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">mmol/litre&nbsp;of&nbsp;serum&nbsp;chloride</span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="estimation-of-serum-plasma-chlorides-by-the-use-of-chloride-meter">Estimation of Serum/Plasma Chlorides by the Use of Chloride Meter<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#estimation-of-serum-plasma-chlorides-by-the-use-of-chloride-meter" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p><strong>Principle</strong> This is an electrometric titration (coulometry) where silver ions are released from the electrode through electrolysis. The specimen is placed in an electrochemical cell. The electricity generates silver ions from the silver anode which are attracted towards the cathode. As the silver ions travel through the diluted specimen, they come in contact with the chloride ions and form silver chloride. The silver chloride is precipitated. This process continues till all the chloride ions are removed from the specimen. When free silver ions are released in the solution, they reach the cathode and bring about a sudden change in the conductivity of the solution. This increase in the potential shuts off the instrument. Thus, with a constant current, the time taken till this point is the measure of concentration of plasma chlorides.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="reagents">Reagents<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#reagents" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="1-diluting-fluid">1. Diluting fluid<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#1-diluting-fluid" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<table><thead><tr><th>Glacial acetic acid</th><th>100 ml</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Conc. nitric acid</td><td>6.4 ml</td></tr><tr><td>Deionised water up to</td><td>1 litre</td></tr></tbody></table>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="2-indicator-solution">2. Indicator solution<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-indicator-solution" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<table><thead><tr><th>Unflavoured gelatin</th><th>6.0 g</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Thymol blue</td><td>0.1 g</td></tr><tr><td>Thymol</td><td>0.1 g</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>Dissolve in about 500 ml of deionised water with gentle heat. Cool and dilute up to 1 litre. Store at 2–8°C.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="3-standard-chloride-solution-100-mmol-l">3. Standard chloride solution (100 mmol/L)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3-standard-chloride-solution-100-mmol-l" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>Dissolve 5.85 g of sodium chloride in 100 ml of deionised water.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="method">Method<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#method" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Mix 0.1 ml of serum with 10 ml of diluting fluid in a beaker.</li>
<li>Add 2–3 drops of the indicator solution.</li>
<li>Immerse the electrodes and switch on the machine.</li>
<li>The digital display starts.</li>
<li>The concentration of chlorides in mmol/L is indicated when the digital display stops.</li>
<li>Repeat the same procedure with 0.1 ml of standard to confirm the accuracy of the result.</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>Normal values</strong> Serum/plasma chlorides: 75–105 mmol/L</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="clinical-significance">Clinical Significance<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#clinical-significance" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>A decrease in serum or plasma chloride occurs in conditions where there is low serum or plasma Na⁺, or when HCO₃⁻ is raised.</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>182 Clinical Chemistry</p>
<p>Loss of chlorides is associated with nephritis, diabetic acidosis, or excessive fluid loss. Higher levels of chloride are observed in congestive heart failure and decreased renal blood flow.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="blood-gases-and-bicarbonate">BLOOD GASES AND BICARBONATE<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#blood-gases-and-bicarbonate" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="exchange-of-blood-gases">Exchange of Blood Gases<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#exchange-of-blood-gases" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>Haemoglobin, an iron containing protein in the red cells, carries oxygen in the blood. When the partial pressure of oxygen (PO₂) in the lungs is high, haemoglobin takes up oxygen, and releases it when the PO₂ is low. Every gram of haemoglobin combines with 1.34 ml of oxygen. The PO₂ in the tissues is lower than that in the blood. Therefore, PO₂ in the blood reduces in order to balance with the PO₂ in the tissues. This causes the oxygen to dissociate from the haemoglobin and pass into the plasma.</p>
<p>The transfer of CO₂ in the lungs occurs in the same way when PCO₂ in the blood from the tissues is higher than PCO₂ in the alveolar air in the lungs.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="ph-of-blood">pH of Blood<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#ph-of-blood" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>pH of blood is an important parameter of determining the acid-base balance of the body. The pH of the extracellular fluid should be kept within the narrow limits of pH 7.37 to 7.45 in order to maintain proper functioning of the body. Carbonic acid (H₂CO₃) influences the acid-base balance because it is abundantly produced from the aerobic metabolism of organic compounds in the tissues. The equilibrium between acid and base ions is held constant to a large extent by bicarbonate ions (HCO₃⁻) which act as a buffering system.</p>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">+</mo></msup><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">−</mo></msubsup><mo>⇌</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>⇌</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathrm{H}^{+} + \mathrm{HCO}_{3}^{-} \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{H}_{2}\mathrm{CO}_{3} \rightleftharpoons \mathrm{H}_{2}\mathrm{O} + \mathrm{CO}_{2}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.9047em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8213em;"><span style="top: -3.113em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">+</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.0916em; vertical-align: -0.247em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">HCO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8446em;"><span style="top: -2.453em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">−</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.247em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">⇌</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">CO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">⇌</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathrm">O</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">CO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<p>The blood pH is maintained between 7.37–7.45 by the removal of CO₂ by the lungs during expiration.</p>
<p>Another important mechanism of maintaining acid-base equilibrium is the action of the renal enzyme carbonic anhydrase which catalyses the reaction between CO₂ and H₂O to form carbonic acid. The acid breaks down into H⁺ and HCO₃⁻.</p>
<p>The hydrogen ions are excreted by the kidneys into the urine whereas the bicarbonate ions pass into the plasma to restore the bicarbonate level.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="investigation-of-the-disturbance-of-acid-base-balance">Investigation of the Disturbance of Acid Base Balance<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#investigation-of-the-disturbance-of-acid-base-balance" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>The blood pH, bicarbonate and partial pressure of CO₂(PCO₂) are the three parameters which are frequently used in the assessment of acid-base disturbances. They are interrelated as follows:</p>
<ol>
<li><span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></mrow><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">−</mo></msubsup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mtext>&nbsp;</mtext><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathrm{pH} = \mathrm{pK}_{1} + \log \frac{(\mathrm{HCO}_{3}^{-})}{(\mathrm{Dissolved\ CO}_{2})}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">pH</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.9275em; vertical-align: -0.2441em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">pK</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.207em;"><span style="top: -2.4559em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.2441em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.6236em; vertical-align: -0.52em;"></span><span class="mop">lo<span style="margin-right: 0.01389em;">g</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.1036em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mopen mtight">(</span><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathrm mtight">Dissolved</span><span class="mspace mtight"><span class="mtight">&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mord mathrm mtight">CO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3173em;"><span style="top: -2.357em; margin-right: 0.0714em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.5em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size3 size1 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.143em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose mtight">)</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.5102em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mopen mtight">(</span><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathrm mtight">HCO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8477em;"><span style="top: -2.214em; margin-right: 0.0714em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.5em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size3 size1 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -2.931em; margin-right: 0.0714em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.5em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size3 size1 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">−</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.286em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose mtight">)</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.52em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span></li>
</ol>
<p>where HCO₃⁻ and CO₂ are expressed in mmol/L and pK₁ is a constant. For plasma, pK₁ = 6.1</p>
<p>Or 2. <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></mrow><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">−</mo></msubsup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0.0301</mn><mo>×</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathrm{pH} = \mathrm{pK}_{1} + \log \frac{(\mathrm{HCO}_{3}^{-})}{0.0301 \times \mathrm{PCO}_{2}}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">pH</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.9275em; vertical-align: -0.2441em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">pK</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.207em;"><span style="top: -2.4559em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">1</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.2441em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.5487em; vertical-align: -0.4451em;"></span><span class="mop">lo<span style="margin-right: 0.01389em;">g</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.1036em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">0.0301</span><span class="mbin mtight">×</span><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathrm mtight">PCO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3173em;"><span style="top: -2.357em; margin-right: 0.0714em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.5em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size3 size1 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.143em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.5102em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mopen mtight">(</span><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathrm mtight">HCO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8477em;"><span style="top: -2.214em; margin-right: 0.0714em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.5em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size3 size1 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -2.931em; margin-right: 0.0714em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.5em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size3 size1 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mtight">−</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.286em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose mtight">)</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.4451em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
<p>where PCO₂ is expressed in mmHg and 0.0301 is CO₂ solubility constant.</p>
<p>This is known as the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation. If any two of the above parameters are known the third can be calculated.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="nomogram">Nomogram<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#nomogram" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>A nomogram can be used to determine any one of the above parameters when the other two are known (Fig.7.2). In the absence of a blood gas analyser, blood pH can be determined potentiometrically and bicarbonate by titration method. The PCO₂ can then be determined with the help of nomogram. Join the known values on the nomogram scales with a ruler, and extend the line if necessary, to obtain the third value.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="measurement-of-blood-ph">Measurement of Blood pH<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#measurement-of-blood-ph" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>The blood pH can be measured potentiometrically using the pH meter. Arterial whole blood collected with 1 mg of heparin/ml gives the most accurate results. If any delay in estimation is expected, it can be stored at 2–4°C for up to 3 hours.</p>
<p><strong>Collection of arterial blood:</strong> Insert a needle into the radial, brachial or femoral artery. The arterial blood pressure is much higher than that in the veins. After the removal of the needle, press firmly on the puncture site for several minutes.</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>Electrolytes and Blood Gases 183</p>
<p><img src="assets/images/image-20251218-d73e9b23.jpeg" alt="img-52.jpeg">
Fig. 7.2 Nomogram for the determination of acid-base values</p>
<p><strong>Note</strong> It is difficult to obtain arterial blood. The composition of capillary blood is much closer to that of the arterial blood, and may be used.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="947547d1">Measurement of Blood CO₂<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#947547d1" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Collect the arterial blood and layer it with liquid paraffin to avoid contact with air. PCO₂ is expressed either in mm Hg or in kPa.</p>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mtext>PCO</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>Barometric&nbsp;pressure</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mtext>water&nbsp;vapour&nbsp;pressure</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">%</mi><msub><mtext>CO</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mn>100</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{PCO}_2 = (\text{Barometric pressure}) - (\text{water vapour pressure}) \times \frac{\% \text{CO}_2}{100}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">PCO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Barometric&nbsp;pressure</span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">water&nbsp;vapour&nbsp;pressure</span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.113em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.427em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">100</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">%</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">CO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<p>At 37°C, the water vapour pressure at saturation is 47 mm Hg or 6.25 kPa. If barometric pressure is 750 mmHg or 99.8 kPa at 5.7% CO₂, the PCO₂ is 40 mm Hg or 5.32 kPa</p>
<p>Dissolved CO₂ in mmol/L = PCO₂ mmHg × 0.0301</p>
<p>or Dissolved CO₂ in mmol/L = PCO₂ kPa × 0.226</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="estimation-of-serum-plasma-bicarbonate">Estimation of Serum/Plasma Bicarbonate<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#estimation-of-serum-plasma-bicarbonate" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Plasma bicarbonate or standard bicarbonate is influenced by changes in PCO₂ and oxygen saturation. Under standard conditions when whole blood is equilibrated with PCO₂ at 40 mm Hg and full saturation of haemoglobin with oxygen, the changes in standard bicarbonate are only due to non-respiratory factors. The actual bicarbonate concentration in plasma is not measured directly but can be calculated from the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="principle">Principle<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#principle" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>When serum is mixed with 0.01N hydrochloride acid, there is a loss of acidity due to the bicarbonate in the serum. This decrease in acidity can be determined by titrating against standard 0.01N sodium hydroxide.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="reagents">Reagents<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#reagents" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Saline (1%): Dissolve 1 g in 100 ml distilled water.</li>
</ol>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>184 Clinical Chemistry</p>
<ol start="2">
<li>HCl, 0.01N: Dilute standardised 0.1 N HCl 1:10 with distilled water freshly.</li>
<li>NaOH, 0.01 N: Dilute standardised 0.1N NaOH 1:10 with distilled water. Prepare fresh.</li>
<li>Phenol red indicator: Dissolve 0.1 g of phenol red in 6.0 ml of 0.5 N NaOH and dilute to 100 ml with distilled water.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="method">Method<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#method" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Prepare a control tube as follows: Add 0.1 ml of serum to 5.0 ml of 1% saline and add 2 drops of phenol red indicator. Mix well. This colour corresponds with the end point of the titration.</li>
<li>Pipette 4.0 ml of 1% saline in another tube.</li>
<li>Add 1.0 ml of 0.01 N HCl</li>
<li>Add 0.1 ml of serum and 2 drops of phenol red indicator</li>
<li>Titrate against 0.01 N NaOH till the colour changes from yellow to red. Compare the colour of the end point with the control tube. Note the reading (X ml).</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>Calculation</strong> Serum bicarbonate mmol/L = (1 - X ml of 0.01N NaOH required) × 100</p>
<p><strong>Explanation</strong> Let (1 - X ml) = 'Y'</p>
<p>1 litre of 0.01 N HCl ≡</p>
<p>1 Litre of 0.01 N HCO₃⁻ ≡ 1/100 Eq. HCO₃⁻</p>
<p>Therefore, 1 ml of 0.01 N HCl ≡</p>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>1000</mn></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>100</mn></mfrac><msubsup><mtext>&nbsp;Eq&nbsp;HCO</mtext><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo></msubsup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{1}{1000} \times \frac{1}{100} \text{ Eq HCO}_3^-</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.0074em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3214em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1000</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.0074em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3214em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">100</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">&nbsp;Eq&nbsp;HCO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8446em;"><span style="top: -2.453em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">−</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.247em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<p>When 1 ml of 0.01 N HCl is added to 0.1 ml of serum, 'y' ml is neutralised by the HCO₃⁻ in 0.1 ml of serum.</p>
<p>Therefore, serum HCO₃⁻ mmol/L =</p>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>100</mn></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mn>1000</mn><mn>0.1</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">y \times \frac{1}{100} \times \frac{1000}{0.1} = y \times 100</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.0074em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3214em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">100</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.0074em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3214em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">0.1</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1000</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7778em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">y</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">100</span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="3e1423ff">Estimation of Total CO₂ (TCO₂)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#3e1423ff" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>The CO₂ liberated from the dissolved CO₂ and HCO₃⁻ from plasma is the total CO₂. Blood should be drawn anaerobically from an artery.</p>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msub><mtext>Total&nbsp;CO</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msubsup><mtext>HCO</mtext><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo></msubsup><mo>+</mo><mn>0.0301</mn><mo>×</mo><msub><mtext>PCO</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mtext>&nbsp;(mmHg)</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{Total CO}_2 = \text{HCO}_3^- + 0.0301 \times \text{PCO}_2 \text{ (mmHg)}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8444em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Total&nbsp;CO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.0916em; vertical-align: -0.247em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">HCO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8446em;"><span style="top: -2.453em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">−</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.247em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">0.0301</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">PCO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">&nbsp;(mmHg)</span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<p>The total CO₂ can be measured in the venous blood using automated equipment.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="blood-gas-analyser">Blood Gas Analyser<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#blood-gas-analyser" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>There are many automated blood gas analysers available. Some of these instruments are fully computerised and are programmed to determine the levels of PCO₂, pH, HCO₃⁻ and PO₂ in a single specimen simultaneously with the help of separate ion selective electrodes (ISE) for each parameter.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="normal-values">Normal values<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#normal-values" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>pH = 7.37 - 7.45</p>
<p>PCO₂ = 34 - 45 mmHg (4.52 - 5.98 kPa) or 1.02 - 1.35 mmol/L</p>
<p>Standard bicarbonate: 22.4 - 25.8 mmol/L</p>
<p>Actual bicarbonate = 24 - 33 mmol/l</p>
<p>PO₂ = 83 - 108 mm Hg</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="clinical-significance">Clinical Significance<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#clinical-significance" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Disturbances in acid-base balance may be either respiratory or metabolic in origin. These disturbances are medically referred to as acidosis or alkalosis.</p>
<p><strong>Acidosis</strong> It is an abnormal process which produces acidaemia (a blood pH below 7.37), or would do so if no compensation were to occur.</p>
<p><strong>Alkalosis</strong> It is an abnormal process which produces alkalaemia (a blood pH above 7.45), or do so if no compensation were to occur.</p>
<p>Table 7.1 shows the test results obtained in disturbances of acid-base balance.</p>
<p><strong>Anion gap</strong> The anion gap is a mathematical approximation of the difference between the cations and the anions routinely measured in serum. Routine electrolyte measurements include Na⁺, K⁺, Cl⁻ and HCO₃⁻. The unmeasured cations such as Ca²⁺ and Mg²⁺ average 7 mmol/L, where as unmeasured anions such as protein, PO₄³⁻ and SO₄²⁻ average about 24 mmol/L. In a normal healthy individual, the concentration of cations should be equal to the concentration of anions. That is,</p>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><msup><mtext>Na</mtext><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mtext>K</mtext><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><msup><mtext>Cl</mtext><mo>−</mo></msup><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mtext>HCO</mtext><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo></msubsup><mo>+</mo><mn>24</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{Na}^+ + \text{K}^+ + 7 = \text{Cl}^- + \text{HCO}_3^- + 24</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.9279em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Na</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8446em;"><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">+</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.9279em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">K</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8446em;"><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">+</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">7</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.939em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Cl</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8557em;"><span style="top: -3.1473em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">−</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.0916em; vertical-align: -0.247em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">HCO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8446em;"><span style="top: -2.453em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">−</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.247em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">24</span></span></span></span></span></div>
<p>or</p>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mtext>Na</mtext><mo>+</mo></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mtext>K</mtext><mo>+</mo></msup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>−</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mtext>Cl</mtext><mo>−</mo></msup><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mtext>HCO</mtext><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo></msubsup><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>17</mn><mtext>&nbsp;mmol/L</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">(\text{Na}^+ + \text{K}^+) - (\text{Cl}^- + \text{HCO}_3^-) = 17 \text{ mmol/L}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.0946em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Na</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8446em;"><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">+</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.0946em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">K</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8446em;"><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">+</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.1057em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mopen">(</span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Cl</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8557em;"><span style="top: -3.1473em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">−</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.0946em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">HCO</span></span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8446em;"><span style="top: -2.453em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">3</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.1362em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mbin mtight">−</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.247em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose">)</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">17</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">&nbsp;mmol/L</span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>Electrolytes and Blood Gases 185</p>
<p>Table 7.1 Laboratory test results in the disturbances of acid-base balance</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Parameters</th><th>Respiratory acidosis</th><th>Respiratory alkalosis</th><th>Metabolic acidosis</th><th>Metabolic alkalosos</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Blood pH</td><td>Low</td><td>High</td><td>Low</td><td>High</td></tr><tr><td>PCO_{2}</td><td>High</td><td>Low</td><td>Normal or low</td><td>Normal or high</td></tr><tr><td>Plasma Bicarbonate</td><td>High</td><td>Low</td><td>Very low</td><td>Very high</td></tr><tr><td>PO_{2}</td><td>High</td><td>Low</td><td>Low</td><td>High</td></tr><tr><td>Causes</td><td>Carbonic acid excess due to hypoventilation and CO_{2} accumulation</td><td>Low carbonic acid due to hyperventilation and low CO_{2} level</td><td>Bicarbonate deficit due to excessive excretion of urinary bicarbonate</td><td>Excess bicarbonate due to low excretion of bicarbonate by the kidney</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>If the anion gap exceeds 17 mmol/L, this usually indicates significantly increased concentrations of unmeasured ions due to conditions such as ketotic states (diabetes, starvation or alcoholism), uraemia, increase in plasma proteins or ingestion of toxic substances.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="calcium">CALCIUM<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#calcium" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Calcium which forms part of the structural mineral in bone, is a major cation in the body. Many methods are available for the estimation of the level of calcium in serum or plasma. Some methods depend on the precipitation of insoluble calcium salt. Widely used methods are the atomic absorption flame photometry and titration with EDTA. Dye-binding methods have become popular e.g. methylthymol blue or cresophthalein complexone methods.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="measurement-of-serum-calcium-using-a-methylthymol-blue">Measurement of Serum Calcium Using a Methylthymol blue<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#measurement-of-serum-calcium-using-a-methylthymol-blue" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Principle Calcium ions produce a deep blue complex with methyl-thymol. Magnesium interferes with the analysis; 8-hydroxyquinoline is added to minimise the interference.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="reagents">Reagents<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#reagents" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>
<p>Dye solution
Methylthymol blue, sodium salt 0.18 g
Polyvinyl pyrrolidone 6.0 g
8-hydroxyquinoline 7.2 g
Hydrochloric acid concentrated 10 ml
Distilled water to 1 litre</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Diluent
Sodium sulphite 24 g
Ethanolamine 220 ml
Distilled water to 1 litre</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Working reagent
Mix equal volumes of reagents (1) and (2).</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Calcium standard (stock)
10 mmol/litre: Place 1.0 g of dry calcium carbonate in a 1 litre volumetric flask. Add 7.3 ml of concentrated hydrochloric acid and make up to 1 litre mark with distilled water.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Calcium standard (working)
2.5 mmol/litre: To 25 ml of 10 mmol/litre standard solution, add 75 ml distilled water. This is the working standard solution.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="method">Method<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#method" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>To 50 µl of test sample, add 3.0 ml of working reagent.</li>
<li>To 50 µl of 2.5 mmol/litre standard add 3.0 ml of working reagent.</li>
</ol>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>186 Clinical Chemistry</p>
<ol start="3">
<li>Read the absorbances against the working reagent as blank at 612 nm (red filter)</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="calculations">Calculations<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#calculations" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>The concentration of calcium is given as:</p>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mtext>Ab.&nbsp;Test</mtext><mtext>Ab.&nbsp;Standard</mtext></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>2.5</mn><mtext>&nbsp;(mmol/litre)</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">= \frac{\text{Ab. Test}}{\text{Ab. Standard}} \times 2.5 \text{ (mmol/litre)}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.0574em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3714em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Ab.&nbsp;Standard</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Ab.&nbsp;Test</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">2.5</span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">&nbsp;(mmol/litre)</span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<p><strong>Note</strong></p>
<ol>
<li>For a more accurate result, the test should be performed in duplicate and absorbances taken separately. The difference in absorbance should be ± 0.2.</li>
<li>Any slightest contamination with extraneous calcium will give incorrect result. Glassware for calcium assay should therefore be acid washed with dilute HCl to remove all traces of calcium.</li>
<li>Do not use plasma of blood anticoagulated with EDTA. Use serum or plasma from heparinised blood.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="normal-range">Normal range<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#normal-range" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>2.3 – 2.7 mmol/L (9.2 – 11.0 mg/dl)</p>
<p>Conversion to mg/dl = mmol/L × 4</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="clinical-significance">Clinical Significance<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#clinical-significance" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p><strong>Hypercalcaemia</strong> Hypercalcaemia (high calcium level) is seen in conditions such as hyperparathyroidism, cancer metastases in bones, alkalosis (diet for peptic ulcer), hypervitaminosis D and multiple myeloma.</p>
<p><strong>Hypocalcaemia</strong> Reduced calcium levels are found in conditions such as hypoparathyroidism, chronic glomerulonephritis, rickets, malabsorption syndromes and acute pancreatitis.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="phosphorus">PHOSPHORUS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#phosphorus" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Phosphorus is found in every cell of the body. The body contains about 17 mol of phosphorus of which 80% is combined with calcium in bones and teeth. It is a constituent of many compounds such as proteins, lipids, carbohydrates and some coenzymes.</p>
<p>Phosphorus in blood can be classified into four groups:</p>
<ol>
<li>Inorganic phosphorus which is present as H₂PO₄⁻ and HPO₄⁻</li>
<li>Organic or ester phosphorus, e.g. glycerophosphate and nucleotide phosphate.</li>
<li>Lipid phosphorus, lecithin, cephalin and sphingomyelin.</li>
<li>Residual phosphorus in small quantities.</li>
</ol>
<p>Red blood cells contain larger amount of phosphorus than plasma. This is because they contain more ester phosphates. The metabolism of phosphorus is closely associated with that of calcium.</p>
