<ol start="3">
<li>Glycerol-3-phosphate is oxidised by glycerol phosphate oxidase to dihydroxyacetone and hydrogen peroxide.</li>
</ol>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mtext>Glycerol-3-phosphate</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mtext>Glycerol-3-phosphate&nbsp;oxidase</mtext></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mtext>dihydroxyacetone</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">.</mi></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
\text{Glycerol-3-phosphate} + \mathrm{O}_2 \\
\text{Glycerol-3-phosphate oxidase} \\
\text{dihydroxyacetone} + \mathrm{H}_2\mathrm{O}_2.
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 3.6em; vertical-align: -1.55em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 2.05em;"><span style="top: -4.21em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Glycerol-3-phosphate</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">O</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.01em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Glycerol-3-phosphate&nbsp;oxidase</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -1.81em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">dihydroxyacetone</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">O</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord">.</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.55em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<ol start="4">
<li>Oxygen is released from <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\mathrm{H}_2\mathrm{O}_2</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8333em; vertical-align: -0.15em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">O</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span> in the presence of peroxidase, which oxidises p-chlorophenol chromogen to form a coloured compound.</li>
</ol>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mtable rowspacing="0.16em" columnalign="left" columnspacing="1em"><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mover><mo stretchy="true" minsize="3.0em">→</mo><mpadded width="+0.6em" lspace="0.3em"><mtext>Peroxidase</mtext></mpadded></mover><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mstyle scriptlevel="0" displaystyle="false"><mrow><mo>+</mo><mover><mo stretchy="true" minsize="3.0em">→</mo><mpadded width="+0.6em" lspace="0.3em"><mtext>p-chlorophenol</mtext></mpadded></mover><mtext>coloured&nbsp;product</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mtd></mtr></mtable><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\begin{array}{l}
\mathrm{H}_2\mathrm{O}_2 \xrightarrow{\text{Peroxidase}} \mathrm{H}_2\mathrm{O} + \mathrm{O}_2 \\
+ \xrightarrow{\text{p-chlorophenol}} \text{coloured product}
\end{array}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.9362em; vertical-align: -1.2181em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mtable"><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span><span class="col-align-l"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.7181em;"><span style="top: -3.7181em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.1081em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">O</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; min-width: 1.469em;"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="400em" height="0.522em" viewBox="0 0 400000 522" preserveAspectRatio="xMaxYMin slice"><path d="M0 241v40h399891c-47.3 35.3-84 78-110 128
-16.7 32-27.7 63.7-33 95 0 1.3-.2 2.7-.5 4-.3 1.3-.5 2.3-.5 3 0 7.3 6.7 11 20

-12.5-2.3-1.7-7.5-2.5-15.5-2.5-14 0-21 3.7-21 11 0 2 2 10.3 6 25 20.7 83.3 67
 151.7 139 205zm0 0v40h399900v-40z"></path></svg></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.011em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">H</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mord mathrm">O</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathrm">O</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.3011em;"><span style="top: -2.55em; margin-left: 0em; margin-right: 0.05em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight">2</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.15em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span style="top: -2.25em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3.1081em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">+</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel x-arrow"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.1081em;"><span style="top: -3.322em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight x-arrow-pad"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord text mtight"><span class="mord mtight">p-chlorophenol</span></span></span></span></span><span class="svg-align" style="top: -2.689em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 2.7em;"></span><span class="hide-tail" style="height: 0.522em; min-width: 1.469em;"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="400em" height="0.522em" viewBox="0 0 400000 522" preserveAspectRatio="xMaxYMin slice"><path d="M0 241v40h399891c-47.3 35.3-84 78-110 128
-16.7 32-27.7 63.7-33 95 0 1.3-.2 2.7-.5 4-.3 1.3-.5 2.3-.5 3 0 7.3 6.7 11 20
 11 8 0 13.2-.8 15.5-2.5 2.3-1.7 4.2-5.5 5.5-11.5 2-13.3 5.7-27 11-41 14.7-44.7

-40.5-119-75.5s-58.3-74.8-73-119.5c-4.7-14-8.3-27.3-11-40-1.3-6.7-3.2-10.8-5.5
-12.5-2.3-1.7-7.5-2.5-15.5-2.5-14 0-21 3.7-21 11 0 2 2 10.3 6 25 20.7 83.3 67
 151.7 139 205zm0 0v40h399900v-40z"></path></svg></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.011em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">coloured&nbsp;product</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.2181em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="arraycolsep" style="width: 0.5em;"></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="reagents">Reagents<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#reagents" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="1-colour-reagent">1. Colour reagent<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#1-colour-reagent" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>Solution A: 100 ml of phosphate buffer, pH 7.2 contains</p>
<ul>
<li>Lipase 30 units</li>
<li>Glycerol kinase 10 units</li>
<li>Glycerol-3-phosphate oxidase 5 units</li>
<li>Peroxidase 5 units</li>
<li>Store at 2–8°C</li>
</ul>
<p>Solution B: p-chlorophenol: Dissolve 30 mg in 100 ml distilled water.</p>
<p>Store at 2–8°C</p>
<p>Colour reagent: Mix two parts of solution A with one part of solution B just before use.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="2-triglyceride-standard-100-mg-dl-dissolve-100-mg-of-triolein-in-100-ml-chloroform">2. Triglyceride standard (100 mg/dl) Dissolve 100 mg of triolein in 100 ml chloroform.<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-triglyceride-standard-100-mg-dl-dissolve-100-mg-of-triolein-in-100-ml-chloroform" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p><strong>Method</strong>: Set up three tubes as follows:</p>
<table><thead><tr><th></th><th>Test</th><th>Standard</th><th>Blank</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Colour reagent</td><td>3.0 ml</td><td>3.0 ml</td><td>3.0 ml</td></tr><tr><td>Serum</td><td>0.03 ml</td><td>–</td><td>–</td></tr><tr><td>Triglyceride standard</td><td>–</td><td>0.03 ml</td><td>–</td></tr><tr><td>Distilled water</td><td>–</td><td>–</td><td>0.03 ml</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>Mix well. Incubate at 37°C for 15 minutes. Read the absorbance of test and standard against the blank at 420 nm (violet filter)</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="calculation">Calculation<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#calculation" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtext>Serum&nbsp;triglyceride&nbsp;mg/dl</mtext><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mtext>Ab&nbsp;Test</mtext><mtext>Ab&nbsp;Standard</mtext></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{Serum triglyceride mg/dl} = \frac{\text{Ab Test}}{\text{Ab Standard}} \times 100</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Serum&nbsp;triglyceride&nbsp;mg/dl</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.0574em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3714em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Ab&nbsp;Standard</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Ab&nbsp;Test</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">100</span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtext>Serum&nbsp;triglyceride&nbsp;mmol/L</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>mg/dl</mtext><mo>×</mo><mn>0.0113</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{Serum triglyceride mmol/L} = \text{mg/dl} \times 0.0113</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Serum&nbsp;triglyceride&nbsp;mmol/L</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">mg/dl</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">0.0113</span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="normal-values">Normal values<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#normal-values" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Triglycerides: 80–150 mg/dl (0.9–1.7 mmol/L)</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="clinical-significance">Clinical Significance<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#clinical-significance" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Increased levels of serum triglycerides have been identified as risk factors related to arteriosclerosis which causes thickening of the walls of larger blood vessels. This may lead to a heart attack.</p>
<p>Other conditions in which raised triglycerides are observed include</p>
<ol>
<li>Liver diseases</li>
<li>Nephrotic syndrome</li>
<li>Hypothyroidism</li>
<li>Diabetes mellitus</li>
<li>Gout</li>
<li>Alcoholism</li>
<li>Pancreatitis</li>
<li>Van Gierke’s disease</li>
<li>Acute myocardial infarction</li>
</ol>
<p>Reduced triglycerides are seen in malnutrition, congenital abetalipoproteinaemia (LDL) or terminal illness.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="determination-of-serum-lipoproteins">DETERMINATION OF SERUM LIPOPROTEINS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#determination-of-serum-lipoproteins" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Visual observation of the serum specimen received in the laboratory may provide valuable information regarding the lipids in the specimen. The chylomicrons and VLDL scatter light because of the large size of their molecules. These are responsible for the opalescence of the serum.</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>Lipids and Lipoproteins 197</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="appearance-of-fasting-plasma-or-serum">Appearance of Fasting Plasma or Serum<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#appearance-of-fasting-plasma-or-serum" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>If a specimen of plasma or serum collected after 12 hours fasting is allowed to stand at 4°C for 18 hours, its appearance can be interpreted as follows:</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Appearance</th><th>Lipid abnormality</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>1. Clear</td><td>Normal; or may have raised LDL (β-lipoprotein)</td></tr><tr><td>2. Clear body and creamy top layer</td><td>Hyperchylomicronaemia</td></tr><tr><td>3. Turbidity dispersed throughout the specimen</td><td>Hyperlipoproteinaemia with high VLDL (pre-β-lipoprotein)</td></tr><tr><td>4. Turbidity throughout the specimen with creamy top layer</td><td>Hyperlipoproteinaemia with both chylomicrons and VLDL raised.</td></tr></tbody></table>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="separation-and-measurement-of-serum-lipoproteins-by-agar-gel-electrophoresis">Separation and Measurement of Serum Lipoproteins by Agar-gel Electrophoresis<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#separation-and-measurement-of-serum-lipoproteins-by-agar-gel-electrophoresis" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>Principle Classification of hyperlipoproteinaemia according to the system of Fredrickson requires quantitation of four classes of lipoproteins. In a routine clinical practice, this is achieved by electrophoresis, preferably in agarose gel. At pH 8.8, chylomicrons, if present, remain at the origin. The other major lipoproteins migrate at rates that increases in order of HDL &gt; VLDL &gt; LDL. Depending on their electrophoretic mobility, the lipoproteins are also named as:</p>
<ul>
<li>HDL-α-lipoprotein which moves with the α globulins;</li>
<li>LDL-β-lipoprotein which moves with the β globulins; and</li>
<li>VLDL-pre β-lipoprotein which moves with the α2 globulins.</li>
</ul>
<p>The separated lipoproteins can be stained with a lipid staining dye such as Fat Red 7B, Oil red O or Sudan Black B.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="reagents">Reagents<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#reagents" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ol>
<li>Tris-barbitone buffer, pH 8.8: Dissolve 5.78 g tris methylamine and 9.76 g sodium barbitone in 1 litre distilled water.</li>
<li>Agarose 1% Dissolve 1 g agarose in 100 ml tris-barbitone buffer by heating in a boiling water bath. Dispense in 10 ml amounts and store at 4°C.</li>
<li>Stain, Fat red B Dissolve 0.225 g in 1 litre methanol.</li>
<li>Working solution, Fat red B Mix 6 ml distilled water with 30 ml of the stain just before use.</li>
<li>Rinse solution 50% methanol</li>
<li>Control serum A known non-lipaemic serum with a small crystal of bromophenol blue as a marker.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="method">Method<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#method" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ol>
<li>Melt a tube of agarose (10 ml) in a boiling water bath or use freshly prepared agarose.</li>
<li>Pour it on a glass slide (9 × 9 cm) on a flat surface. Allow it to set at room temperature and place it at 4°C for 15 minutes to harden.</li>
<li>Apply the specimen 3 cm from the edge of the plate.</li>
<li>Apply the control serum in the same way.</li>
<li>Carry out the electrophoresis at 200 V.</li>
<li>End point: Bromophenol blue in the control serum stains the albumin blue. Continue electrophoresis until the stained albumin has migrated 3.5–4 cm.</li>
<li>Remove the plate and air dry with a warm air blower.</li>
<li>Place the plate in the working solution of the stain for 3–5 minutes.</li>
<li>Wash in the rinsing solution till the background is clear. Dry in air.</li>
</ol>
<p>Reading results Three bands are seen in the control serum. They represent β(LDL), pre-β(VLDL) and α-lipoproteins (HDL) from the point of origin. The β-lipoprotein band is the most intense and the pre-β band may be very faint.</p>
<p>Variation in the concentrations of lipoproteins produces variation in the intensity of staining of each band, and needs very careful observation.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="ultracentrifugation-of-lipoproteins">Ultracentrifugation of Lipoproteins<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#ultracentrifugation-of-lipoproteins" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>The lipoproteins can also be separated by ultracentrifugation. They have lower densities than the other solids in plasma due to their lipid content. Secondly, each class of lipoproteins has a different density.</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>198 Clinical Chemistry</p>
<p>At the density of plasma (1.006 kg/L), VLDL floats at the top while LDL and HDL are sedimented.</p>
<p>At the density of 1.063 kg/L, both the LDL and VLDL float. At the density of 1.210 kg/L all the three lipoproteins float.</p>
<p>Lipoproteins can thus be separated from the plasma proteins and from each other by ultracentrifugation at appropriate density.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="classification-of-hyperlipoproteinaemia">Classification of Hyperlipoproteinaemia<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#classification-of-hyperlipoproteinaemia" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Based on the appearance of the lipoprotein particles seen on electrophoresis, Fredrickson and Lees introduced a classification of hyperlipoproteinaemia to assess the risk of arterial disease.</p>
<p>Table 8.2 shows the characteristics of Fredrickson's classification.</p>
<table><thead><tr><th>Type</th><th>Appearance of serum</th><th>Cholesterol</th><th>Triglycerides</th><th>Chylomicrons</th><th>VLDL (pre-β)</th><th>IDL</th><th>LDL (β)</th><th>HDL (α)</th><th>Remarks</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>I</td><td>Clear body, creamy top</td><td>N</td><td>↑↑</td><td>↑↑</td><td>A</td><td>A</td><td>A</td><td>N</td><td>Due to inherited defect in chylomicron metabolism such as lipase deficiency. Erruptive xanthomata and recurrent pancreatitis occurs in childhood.</td></tr><tr><td>II</td><td>Clear</td><td>↑↑</td><td>NN</td><td>A</td><td>A</td><td>A</td><td>↑</td><td>N</td><td>Due to a cellular deficiency of the apolipoprotein B receptor.</td></tr><tr><td>IIB</td><td>Turbidity</td><td>↑↑</td><td>↑</td><td>A</td><td>↑</td><td>A</td><td>↑</td><td>↑</td><td>Secondary to disorders such as hypothyroidism, nephrotic syndrome, obstructive liver disease, etc.</td></tr><tr><td>III</td><td>Clear or turbid body, creamy top</td><td>↑</td><td>↑</td><td>↑</td><td>↑ (occ)</td><td>↑</td><td>A</td><td>N</td><td>Due to impaired hepatic clearance of IDL particles (rare). Electrophoresis shows a γ broad band between β and pre-β.</td></tr><tr><td>IV</td><td>Turbidity throughout</td><td>Nor ↑</td><td>↑↑</td><td>A</td><td>↑</td><td>A</td><td>N</td><td>N</td><td>Due to overproduction of VLDL as a result of high lipid diet (common) or after acute myocardial infarction, pancreatitis and burns.</td></tr><tr><td>V</td><td>Turbid body, creamy top</td><td>↑</td><td>↑↑</td><td>↑</td><td>↑</td><td>A</td><td>↓</td><td>N</td><td>Similar to type I occurring in an adult. Sometimes secondary to diabetes mellitus, pancreatitis, alcoholism, myxodema.</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>Key: A = absent, N = normal, ↑ = increased, ↑↑ = greatly increased, ↓ = reduced, Occ = occasional</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>Chapter 9</p>
<p>Chemical Tests for Diseases of the Alimentary Tract</p>
<p>The alimentary tract extends from the mouth to the anus, and comprises the mouth, pharynx, oesophagus, stomach, small intestine and large intestine including the rectum and anus. The tract is a convoluted tube in which food is ingested, digested, absorbed and excreted. Secretion from organs such as salivary glands, pancreas, liver and biliary tract are poured into the alimentary tract through various ducts.</p>
<p>The stomach contains three important types of cells:</p>
<ol>
<li>Peptic cells: These produce the enzyme pepsin which digests proteins.</li>
<li>Parietal (Oxyntic) cells: These produce hydrochloric acid and intrinsic factor.</li>
<li>Goblet cells: These secrete mucus which protects stomach wall and lubricates the food. Digestion of food takes place in the stomach; and gastric juice is secreted by the cells lining the walls of the stomach. The secretion is prompted by</li>
</ol>
<p>(i) the hormone gastrin which is secreted by the gastric antrum mucosa when food is in the stomach;
(ii) sensory factors (sight, taste or smell of food); and
(iii) the presence of some by-products of digestion.</p>
<p>Until recently, it was a common practice to collect and examine gastric juice after taking a pint of oatmeal gruel. By and large, this has now been replaced by histamine and pentagastrin stimulation tests.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="examination-of-gastric-juice">EXAMINATION OF GASTRIC JUICE<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#examination-of-gastric-juice" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Examination of gastric juice involves four steps:</p>
<p>I. Stimulation
II. Collection
III. Gross examination
IV. Titration of acidity</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="i-stimulated-gastric-juice">I. Stimulated Gastric Juice<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#i-stimulated-gastric-juice" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>The gastric juice is stimulated by anything that enters the stomach, but some foods tend to stimulate the secretion of the juice more than the others. The following are well recognised gastric juice stimulants.</p>
<ol>
<li>One pint (568 ml) of oatmeal gruel.</li>
<li>Tea and toasted bread.</li>
<li>About 100 ml of 7% alcohol with methylene blue as indicator.</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>Direct stimulation method</strong> Some stimulants directly stimulate the parietal cells in the stomach. Histamine acts directly on the parietal cells and stimulates the secretion of gastric acid. It however</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>200 Clinical Chemistry</p>
<p>has unpleasant side effects. It is administered with anti-histamine.</p>
<p>Pentagastrin is a synthetic drug which resembles the active part of gastric hormone gastrin and mimics its action. It is used in the same way as histamine but in smaller amounts. It is expensive but more acceptable than histamine. Pentagastrin has virtually replaced histamine.</p>
<p><strong>Augmented histamine test (AHT)</strong> A modification of the histamine test is the augmented histamine test. In this test, higher doses of histamine are given (about 0.04 mg per kg body weight). All parietal cells capable of acid secretion are stimulated by histamine but this test helps to assess the total functioning parietal cell mass. Even though the AHT and its analogous histology are well established definitive tests, the pentagastrin test has gradually superseded them due to the adverse side effects of AHT. The pentagastrin test and AHT are carried out in similar manner but 6 µg per kg body weight of pentagastrin is administered intramuscularly.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="ii-collection-of-gastric-juice">II. Collection of Gastric Juice<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#ii-collection-of-gastric-juice" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>The collection of gastric juice is usually a ward procedure.</p>
<ol>
<li>The patient must be in the fasting state and free from sight or odour of food overnight.</li>
<li>All medications that can influence gastric secretion must be withheld for 24 hours.</li>
<li>The patient must be isolated from environmental situation evoking untoward psychological responses such as fear, anger or depression.</li>
<li>Pass a number 14 Ryle’s tube through the nose until it is lying on the pyloric antrum. The markings on the tube show how far the tube has been pushed down.</li>
<li>All the gastric juice is aspirated from the stomach. This specimen is the “resting juice”.</li>
<li>In next 1 hour the juice is collected at 15 minutes interval and the sample is called “basal juice”.</li>
<li>The patient is injected intramuscularly with 6 µg per kg body weight of pentagastrin. This gives maximal secretion.</li>
<li>The gastric juice is aspirated for four consecutive 15 minute periods and the samples are labelled 1, 2, 3, 4.</li>
<li>The laboratory should receive the following samples:</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li>Resting juice</li>
<li>Basal juice</li>
<li>Post pentagastrin samples 1, 2, 3, 4.</li>
</ul>
<p>&gt; <strong>Note:</strong> A part of the specimen should be collected in a sterile container and sent for bacteriological examination.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="iii-gross-examination-of-gastric-juice">III. Gross Examination of Gastric Juice<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#iii-gross-examination-of-gastric-juice" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li><strong>Volume</strong> Normal fasting content is about 50-100ml; and the average daily volume is 2-4 litres.</li>
<li><strong>Appearance</strong> It is normally colourless, grey in appearance but the fluid assumes various colours under pathological conditions.</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li>(a) Blood: Blood is red or coffee brown if acid haematin is formed.</li>
<li>(b) Bile: Fresh bile is yellow while old bile is green.</li>
<li>(c) Food colours: In stasis, food colours may persist.</li>
</ul>
<ol start="3">
<li><strong>Odour</strong> Normal odour of gastric fluid is source slightly rancid. It has faecal odour in intestinal obstruction and ammoniacal in uremia.</li>
<li><strong>pH</strong> The pH range is 0.9–1.5 due to hydrochloric acid produced by the parietal cells.</li>
<li><strong>Water</strong> Water content of gastric fluid is about 98–99%.</li>
<li><strong>Other constituents</strong> The gastric juice also contains inorganic substances such as sodium, potassium, chloride, calcium, magnesium, phosphate and sulphate; and organic substances like pepsin, mucin, renin (only in the stomach of a child), albumin, lipase and globulin.</li>
</ol>
<p>Abnormal gastric constituents include</p>
<ul>
<li>(a) Blood</li>
<li>(b) Food remnants hours after eating</li>
</ul>
<ol start="7">
<li><strong>Character of the fluid</strong> When left to stand for 3 hours, three layers are formed:</li>
</ol>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>Chemical Tests for Diseases of the Alimentary Tract 201</p>
<p>(a) Top—mucus
(b) Middle—Opalescent fluid
(c) Bottom—bread-like residue</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="laboratory-procedure">Laboratory procedure<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#laboratory-procedure" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Measure and record the volume of each sample.</li>
<li>Inspect for the presence of blood, bile or mucus. Blood is usually brown due to the change of haemoglobin to acid haematin. Bile will colour the gastric aspirate green.</li>
<li>Determine the pH of the juice using indicator papers or pH meter. If pH is greater than 7.0, titration need not be done.</li>
<li>Determine the titrable acidity of each collection by titration either by manual or automatic titration in the basal and post pentagastric samples.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="iv-titration-of-acidity-in-gastric-juice">IV. Titration of Acidity in Gastric Juice<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#iv-titration-of-acidity-in-gastric-juice" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="reagents">Reagents<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#reagents" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>NaOH, 0.02 N. Dilute 20.0 ml stock solution of 0.1 mol/l of NaOH to 100 ml with distilled water. This gives 0.02 N NaOH. Standardise.</li>
</ol>
<p>This is prepared fresh each day.</p>
<ol start="2">
<li>Indicator. Neutral red, 0.1% in 70% alcohol. Or Phenol red: 0.1 g phenol red, 5.7 ml 0.5 N NaOH diluted to 250 ml with distilled water.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="method">Method<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#method" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<ol>
<li>Spin the gastric juice.</li>
<li>Transfer 1 ml of the clear gastric juice into a small flask, add 2–3 drops of the indicator.</li>
<li>Titrate each sample with the standardised 0.02 N NaOH until a faint pink endpoint is reached.</li>
<li>Note the titre and record the result.</li>
</ol>
<p>&gt; <strong>Note</strong>
&gt; 1. Titrable acidity, which was formerly called total acidity, is the sum of the hydrogen ion concentration and unionised hydrogen ion concentration. This method has superseded the phenolphthalein-Topfer’s reagent method.
&gt; 2. The first permanent pink colour is taken as the end point.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="calculations">Calculations<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#calculations" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>1.0 ml of 0.02 N NaOH is equivalent to 20 mmol/L. Therefore, if <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">t =</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6151em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">t</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span></span></span></span></span> titre of gastric juice, <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">v =</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.4306em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">v</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span></span></span></span></span> volume of sample used for the test, and <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>T</mi><mo>=</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">T =</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6833em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">T</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span></span></span></span></span> volume of specimen collected.</p>
<ol>
<li>Titrable acidity = <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>×</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow><mi>v</mi></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{t \times 20}{v}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.1901em; vertical-align: -0.345em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8451em;"><span style="top: -2.655em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">v</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.394em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">t</span><span class="mbin mtight">×</span><span class="mord mtight">20</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.345em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span></span></span></span></span> in mmol/L</li>
</ol>
<p>Example:</p>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4.4</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>ml</mtext><mo separator="true">,</mo><mtext> </mtext><mi>T</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">t = 4.4, \, v = 1.0 \, \text{ml}, \, T = 25</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6151em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">t</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8389em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord">4.4</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">v</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord">1.0</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">ml</span></span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">T</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">25</span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtext>Titrable&nbsp;acidity</mtext><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4.4</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow><mn>1.0</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>88.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>mmol/L</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{Titrable acidity} = \frac{4.4 \times 20}{1.0} = 88.0 \, \text{mmol/L}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.8889em; vertical-align: -0.1944em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">Titrable&nbsp;acidity</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.0074em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3214em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1.0</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">4.4</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mord">20</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">88.0</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">mmol/L</span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<ol start="2">
<li>Hydrogen iron concentration per specimen</li>
</ol>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mtext>mmol/L</mtext><mo>×</mo><mi>T</mi></mrow><mn>1000</mn></mfrac><mtext>&nbsp;in&nbsp;mmol</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">= \frac{\text{mmol/L} \times T}{1000} \text{ in mmol}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.113em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.427em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1000</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">mmol/L</span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">T</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">&nbsp;in&nbsp;mmol</span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<p>In the above example, hydrogen ion concentration per specimen is</p>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>88.0</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>25</mn></mrow><mn>1000</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>2.2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>mmol</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\frac{88.0 \times 25}{1000} = 2.2 \, \text{mmol}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.0074em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3214em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">1000</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord">88.0</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mord">25</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6944em;"></span><span class="mord">2.2</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">mmol</span></span></span></span></span></span></div>
<ol start="3">
<li>Acidity in mmol/hour</li>
</ol>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mtext>ml&nbsp;of&nbsp;NaOH</mtext><mtext>ml&nbsp;of&nbsp;gastric&nbsp;juice&nbsp;titrated</mtext></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mtext>total&nbsp;volume&nbsp;of&nbsp;specimen</mtext><mtext>period&nbsp;of&nbsp;collection&nbsp;in&nbsp;min</mtext></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">= \frac{\text{ml of NaOH}}{\text{ml of gastric juice titrated}} \times \frac{\text{total volume of specimen}}{\text{period of collection in min}} \times 6</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.3669em;"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2778em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.2519em; vertical-align: -0.8804em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3714em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">ml&nbsp;of&nbsp;gastric&nbsp;juice&nbsp;titrated</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">ml&nbsp;of&nbsp;NaOH</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8804em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.2519em; vertical-align: -0.8804em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3714em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">period&nbsp;of&nbsp;collection&nbsp;in&nbsp;min</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">total&nbsp;volume&nbsp;of&nbsp;specimen</span></span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8804em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">6</span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div class="math math-display"><span class="katex-display"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block"><semantics><mrow><mtext>i.e.&nbsp;</mtext><mfrac><mi>t</mi><mi>v</mi></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mfrac><mi>T</mi><mtext>period&nbsp;of&nbsp;collection</mtext></mfrac><mo>×</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\text{i.e. } \frac{t}{v} \times \frac{T}{\text{period of collection}} \times 6</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1.9781em; vertical-align: -0.686em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">i.e.&nbsp;</span></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.2921em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.03588em;">v</span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">t</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.686em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 2.2408em; vertical-align: -0.8804em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mopen nulldelimiter"></span><span class="mfrac"><span class="vlist-t vlist-t2"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 1.3603em;"><span style="top: -2.314em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">period&nbsp;of&nbsp;collection</span></span></span></span><span style="top: -3.23em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="frac-line" style="border-bottom-width: 0.04em;"></span></span><span style="top: -3.677em;"><span class="pstrut" style="height: 3em;"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal" style="margin-right: 0.13889em;">T</span></span></span></span><span class="vlist-s">​</span></span><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist" style="height: 0.8804em;"><span></span></span></span></span></span><span class="mclose nulldelimiter"></span></span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">×</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.6444em;"></span><span class="mord">6</span></span></span></span></span></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="normal-values">Normal values<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#normal-values" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="titrable-acidity">Titrable acidity<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#titrable-acidity" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>Basal acidity = <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex-error" title="ParseError: KaTeX parse error: Expected 'EOF', got '&amp;' at position 1: &amp;̲lt; 2 \, \text{…" style="color: rgb(204, 0, 0);">&amp;lt; 2 \, \text{mmol/L}</span></span></p>
<p>Maximal acidity = <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>mmol/L</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1 - 20 \, \text{mmol/L}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">20</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">mmol/L</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h3 level="3" id="acidity-in-mmol-hour">Acidity in mmol/hour<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#acidity-in-mmol-hour" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h3></div>
<p>Basal secretion rate = <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2.5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>mmol/hour</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">1 - 2.5 \, \text{mmol/hour}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">1</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">2.5</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">mmol/hour</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
<p>Maximal secretion rate = <span class="math math-inline"><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>mmol/hour</mtext></mrow><annotation encoding="application/x-tex">20 - 40 \, \text{mmol/hour}</annotation></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 0.7278em; vertical-align: -0.0833em;"></span><span class="mord">20</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span><span class="mbin">−</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.2222em;"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut" style="height: 1em; vertical-align: -0.25em;"></span><span class="mord">40</span><span class="mspace" style="margin-right: 0.1667em;"></span><span class="mord text"><span class="mord">mmol/hour</span></span></span></span></span></span></p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="clinical-significance">Clinical Significance<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#clinical-significance" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Hypersecretion of gastric acidity (hyperchlorhydria) is indicative of peptic and duodenal</li>
</ol>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>202 Clinical Chemistry</p>
<p>ulcers in which acid secretion is high. For duodenal ulcer, the value of basal acidity is &gt; 5 mmol/L while the maximal total acidity is 20–60 mmol/L. Hyperchlorhydria is also indicative of Zollinger-Ellison syndrome in which basal acidity secretions is &gt; 10 mmol/L.</p>
<ol start="2">
<li>Hyposecretion of gastric acidity (hypochlorhydria) or absence of gastric acidity (achlorhydria) is associated with pernicious anaemia, gastric carcinoma and chronic gastritis.</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="automatic-titration">Automatic Titration<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#automatic-titration" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>In automated equipment, the burette is mechanically filled and controlled by a specially designed pH meter. The sample is mechanically stirred and the titrant added until the required pH is reached. In titrating gastric juice, the apparatus is set for an end point of pH 7.0.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="insulin-hypoglycaemia-test">Insulin (Hypoglycaemia) Test<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#insulin-hypoglycaemia-test" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Acid secretion is stimulated by hypoglycaemia induced by insulin administration due to stimulation of vagus nerve. The test is performed to determine the efficiency of vagotomy. The major stimulus is transmitted via the vagus nerve and this stimulation can therefore be removed by vagotomy.</p>
<p>The samples of gastric juice are collected and titrated in the same way as described for the pentagastrin test. Samples for blood glucose are taken upon completion of the basal secretion study at 30, 60 and 90 minutes after insulin injection, and analysed for glucose estimation. This test is limited to patients with recurrent ulceration after vagotomy, which may be incomplete. A successful vagotomy show no rise in acidity after a sufficient dose of insulin.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="occult-blood-in-faeces">OCCULT BLOOD IN FAECES<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#occult-blood-in-faeces" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>Blood in faeces may be as a result of bleeding into the gastrointestinal tract with rapid vomiting of blood (haematemesis) or due to passage of blood through the rectum. But when the bleeding is chronic, the blood (or its breakdown products) becomes non-recognisable in the faeces and it is referred to as occult (hidden) blood.</p>
<p>Occult blood is investigated in order to diagnose iron deficiency anaemia, peptic ulceration or cancer of the gastrointestinal tract.</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="tests-for-occult-blood">Tests for Occult Blood<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#tests-for-occult-blood" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>The presence of large amount of occult blood gives the stool a black tar-like appearance. Fresh blood on the surface of the stool may be due to rectal or vaginal (menstrual) bleeding. This blood should not be regarded as a positive occult blood as this will be misleading. It will naturally give a positive reaction to occult blood test methods which are of no value in the presence of fresh blood. It should be clearly stated when issuing reports that fresh blood was macroscopically seen.</p>
<p>The principle of chemical tests to detect occult blood is based on the fact that haemoglobin and its derivatives react in a similar way to peroxidase enzymes—by catalysing the transfer of an oxygen atom from a peroxide to a chromogen such as benzidine, o-toluidine, guaiac or aminophenazone. Oxidation of the chromogen is indicated by the production of a blue, blue-green or pink colour. Unfortunately two chromogens, benzidine and o-toluidine which give satisfactory results, have been found to be carcinogenic and so their use is no longer justified.</p>
<p>Tests for occult blood may give false positive or false negative results. Therefore, the interpretation of test results must be carried out with caution.</p>
<p>Nearly, all occult blood tests are packaged into kit forms based on the above-mentioned principle. Two good examples of such test kits are:</p>
<ol>
<li>Okokit tablet test Supplied along with the kit are</li>
</ol>
<p>(a) Diluent
(b) Okokit tablet and
(c) Test papers</p>
<p>Scanned by CamScanner</p>
<p>Chemical Tests for Diseases of the Alimentary Tract 203</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="method">Method<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#method" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Prepare a thin smear of the faeces in the centre of the test paper.</li>
<li>One okokit tablet is placed in the centre of the smear.</li>
<li>Two or three drops of diluent are applied on the tablet.</li>
<li>Two more drops are added after 2 minutes.</li>
<li>Read the colour change after 5 minutes.</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>Negative:</strong> No colour change around the tablet.</p>
<p><strong>Positive (++):</strong> Dark blue colour around the tablet.</p>
<p><strong>Positive (+):</strong> Pale blue colour around the tablet (this can be viewed from the reverse side of the test paper held up to direct light).</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="2-haemoccult-method-slide-and-tape-test">2. Haemoccult method (Slide and tape test)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#2-haemoccult-method-slide-and-tape-test" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<p>This method uses filter paper envelopes impregnated with guaiac resin (1 g guaiac in 5 ml 95% ethanol in a brown bottle and stored at 4°C for 1 month). The filter paper is smeared thinly with faeces and allowed to dry. Two drops of hydrogen peroxide are added to the smear.</p>
